creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: large garden pond with lily pads; boulders, stone lantern, rolling green turf in middle ground; silhouettes of foliage in background; tangled, blossoming wisteria dominates the frame
inscription: left: 自摺　昭和拾年作　藤之庭 {jizuri, Shōwa jūnen saku, Fuji no niwa} | bottom, printed: Wistaria | in pencil: Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LLC, red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Wisteria Garden
